required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Surgical Management of Placenta Accreta a Three Year Experience at King Hussein Medical Center

lead_sponsor.agency: Royal Medical Services, Jordanian Armed Forces

clinical_study.source: Royal Medical Services, Jordanian Armed Forces

brief_summary.textblock: purpose of this study was to report our experience for surgical management of suspected placenta accreta cases encountered in King Hussein medical center

detailed_description.textblock: was a retrospective study of all patients who underwent planned deliveries for placenta accreta at King Hussein Medical Centre (KHMC) from August 2011 to October 2014.Demographic characteristics were recorded. Ultrasound (U/S) and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) were used for the diagnosis. Surgery for all patients were performed by multidisciplinary teams. All information were obtained from patient's files.

primary_outcome.measure: The intraoperative and short term postoperative complications of surgical interventions in placenta accreta
primary_outcome.description: Intraoperative visceral injuries, bleeding, and short term postoperative morbidity and mortality

clinical_study.condition: To Publish Our Experience in the Surgical Management to Placenta Accreta Cases and the Maternal Outcome

intervention.intervention_name: Bakrey balloon insertion within the uterus and caesarean hysterectomy
intervention.description: Creating an intrauterine tamponade to stop the uterine bleeding by inflating an intrauterine balloon with 600 cc of saline versus undergoing hysterectomy if conservative management failed
intervention.other_name: Interventional radiological insertion of balloon to obstuct the internal iliac artery

study_pop.textblock: All pregnant ladies who were diagnosed to have placenta previa accreta cases which was diagnosed using ultrasound or MRI

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all placenta previa accreta cases encountered in our institution over three year period
Exclusion Criteria:
-

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Royal Medical Services, Jordanian Armed Forces
responsible_party.investigator_title: Dr. Mitri Rashed, senior specialist in obstetrics and gynaecology and IVF
